intro: Cynoglossum ovatifolium, commonly known as broadleaf mouse ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, soft down. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Cynoglossum ovatifolium is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
